column4: Okay, someone *must* know this now, I'm dying of curiosity.. I've tried numerous distros the last few days, and the *only* one that's gotten my K8M800 UniChrome IGP graphics adapter to work is ubuntu.. What have you done to it that no other distro has managed to do?
more than likely the other distros you tried didnt have the drivers for it preinstalled
ubuntu uses the regular xorg via_drv.. or so it seems
I've tried to install other drivers from source, but they tend to lock my whole system up
